instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3_OUT: What is PPVRTC_G3_OUT? PPVRTC_G3_OUT is a 3.3v power line that comes out of the clock chip. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins but won't turn on
threads.message:
hello

the device turns on and the backlight is not on. There was some corrosion in the <TRANSISTOR>Q2620</TRANSISTOR> area. I renewed the solders, but now the fan is spinning, there is no opening sound. I tried removing the ram and still no sound. It stays at 0.87 amps

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 16.72 volt
<SIGNAL>PVIN_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> : 12.8 volt
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL> : 3,4 volt
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3_OUT</SIGNAL> : 3.3 volt
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> : 5 volt volt
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS_FET</SIGNAL> : 5 volt
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> : 3.3 volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins but won't turn on
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 16.72 volt
<SIGNAL>PVIN_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> : 12.8 volt"
How is this possible?
Is the same power line.
Please, post accurate information.

Do you get voltage at L7510/20?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins but won't turn on
threads.message:
sorry for the misreading

L7510/20 : 1.1 volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins but won't turn on
threads.message:
VCORE must drop from 1.1V to 0.7V aprox when the board boots.
If stuck on 1.1V, may be RAM problem, BIOS, or PCH/CPU.

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Do you have DDR3 test card?
